entry.title: Notes on reed quality evaluation of single reed instrument
entry.content:
Background

The musical quality of woodwind instruments such as clarinet or saxophone depends strongly on the reed quality.

Using our own experience of musician, we consider that 30% of reeds in a box are good reeds, whereas 40% are mean quality reeds and 30% are considered as bad.
Moreover, we assume that great differences in the subjective
quality perceived by the musician remain constant over long time periods (few months), such tha extreme values of quality does not change over time (very bad reeds remain very bad and very good reeds remain very good).

Methods

This paper consists THREE types of measurement of reeds:

  1. Subjective characterization
  2. Mechanical paramenters (in vitro)
  3. Playing parameters (in vivo)

1. Subjective characterization

Experiment Testbed:

  • 12 reeds for tenor saxophone of the same brand, same cut and same strengths have been considered
  • Reference 54 Selmer saxophone
  • Vandoren V16 T8 mouthpiece
  • ** The musician was asked to play each reed and to assess each descriptor on a 5-levels structured rating scale (from 1: low score to 5: high score). **
  • Each reed was repeated three times and the average value of each descriptor was calculated from the three evaluations.
  • The reeds were presented in a random order.
  • The musician was also asked to play a given musical phrase, which was recorded. The musical phrase used for the test is a descending arpeggio of 7 notes (C5 523.3 Hz, G4 392 Hz, Eb4 311.1 Hz, C4 261.6 Hz, G3 196 Hz, Eb3 155.6 Hz, C3 130.8 Hz).
  • For each reed, the arpeggio has been played five times (5 repetitions) in order to estimate the average and the standard deviation of the different objective parameters.

Descriptors:

2. Mechanical paramenters (in vitro)

Experiment Testbed:

  • (static) pressure Pm
  • The mouth pressure is measured using a differential pressure sensor Endevco 8507-C2
  • The acoustic pressure is measured using a 1/4 inch
    microphone (B&K 4135) placed in front of the saxophone bell
  • The signals are connected to
    an acquisition board National instruments BNC-2110 using a sampling frequency Fs = 50 kHz

Descriptors:

  • Mouth pressure (hPa)
  • Acoustic pressure (Pa)

Feature extraction: (stationary part)
• Harmonic Spectral Centroid (HSC)
• Odd Harmonic Spectral Centroid (OHSC)
• Even Harmonic Spectral Centroid (EHSC)
• Odd/Even Ratio (OER)
• Tristimulus, 1st coefficient (TR1)
• Tristimulus, 2nd coefficient (TR2)
• Tristimulus, 3rd coefficient (TR3)
• High Frequency Components (HFC4)
• Mean Mouth Pressure (MMP)

3. Playing parameters (in vivo)

Experiment Testbed:

  • The acoustic pressure exciting the reed p is measured using a 1/8 inch microphone (B & K 4138) at 5 mm from the tip of the mouthpiece
  • The reed displacement y is
    measured using an optical sensor (Philtec RC 25) having a measuring area of about 1 x 4 mm
  • the response of the reed is characterized by measuring the Frequency Response Function displacement
    over acoustic pressure at the middle of the reed (in the transverse direction) and at 2 mm from the tip
  • Measurements were performed with the force sensor (FSR) always placed between the reed
    and the lip and the lip pressure (force) was always set on the same value.

Descriptors:

  • stiffness
  • quality factor
  • mass

Reference:

  • Gazengel, Bruno & Petiot, Jean-François. (2013). Objective and subjective characterization of saxophone reeds.

entry.title: SCI Journal List on Music Technology
entry.content:
SCI Journals

 Acta Acustica united with Acustica

 IEEE Signal Processing Magazine（很难）

 IEEE Signal Processing Letters

 Music Perception

 Journal of the Acoustical Society of America

 Trends in Cognitive Sciences

 IEEE Transactions on Pattern Analysis and Machine Intelligence

 IEEE Transactions on Neural Networks and Learning Systems

 SIAM Review（最权威的优秀数学期刊）

 IEEE Transactions on Cybernetics(审稿期长)

 IEEE Transactions on Human-Machine Systems（慢）

 IEEE Transactions on Robotics

 IEEE Transactions on Knowledge and Data Engineering

 Pattern Recognition

 IEEE-ACM Transactions on Audio, Speech and Language Processing(CCF B类)（3个月）
是音频、声学、语言信号处理的顶级期刊。期刊文章专注于语音增强，声源定位、回声消除，语音识别等问题，现在上面的文章更多的开始偏向机器学习方面。尤其是在和acm学会的相关部分合并改名后，可以看到每一期的文章中，都是基于机器学习的文章占了半数以上。

 Journal of Speech, Language, and Hearing Research(JSLHR) (CCF B类)

 IEEE Transactions on Affective Computing

 Machine Learning

 Journal of Machine Learning Research

 Neural Networks

 IEEE Transactions on Multimedia

 Transactions on Automation Science and Engineering

 IEEE Transactions on Information Theory

 PLoS One

 Journal of Artificial Intelligence Research

 Pattern Recognition Letters

 Neural Computation

 Neurocomputing

 International Journal of Social Robotics

 ACM Transactions on Computer-Human Interaction

 Signal Processing

 Proceedings of the Royal Society of London. Mathematical, Physical and Engineering Sciences

 Human-Computer Interaction

 Applied Acoustics

 International Journal of Human-Computer Interaction

 International Journal of Human-Computer Studies

 Journal of the Audio Engineering Society

 IEEE Pervasive Computing

 IET Signal Processing

 Journal on Multimodal User Interfaces

 Journal of New Music Research

 ACM Transactions on Applied Perception

 EURASIP Journal on Audio Speech and Music Processing

 EURASIP Journal on Advances in Signal Processing

 Organised Sound
（无数据）
 Applied Sciences

 Computational Intelligence and Neuroscience

 Journal of Mathematics and Music

 Computer Music Journal

 Leonardo Music Journal

注：数据来源（http://www.letpub.com.cn/），搜集信息不易，请尊重原创。

entry.title: hello-world
entry.content:
Welcome to Hexo! This is your very first post. Check documentation for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in troubleshooting or you can ask me on GitHub.
